snippet: A broadside by Senator Dianne Feinstein has set up a showdown between the executive and legislative branches of government, and may well have permanently chilled her relations with the spy agency she oversees.
abstract: Sen Dianne Feinstein's accusation that the Central Intelligence Agency had engaged in spying and intimidation of Senate staff has set up a showdown between the executive and legislative branches of government; Feinstein's broadside may have permanently chilled her relations with the spy agency, which she oversees, but even some former CIA officials think the agency could have better handled the standoff with Democrats on the Senate Intelligence Committee.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and MARK MAZZETTI

lead_paragraph: A broadside by Senator Dianne Feinstein has set up a showdown between the executive and legislative branches of government, and may well have permanently chilled her relations with the spy agency she oversees.

headline.main: Senator’s Simmering Battle With C.I.A. Over Detentions Report
headline.print_headline: Senator’s Simmering Battle With C.I.A. Over Detentions Report
